>
> Hi Vincent,
>
> Oops. Looking through the JUnit code, I seem to have propagated another
> urban myth.

:-)

>
> That said, I always believed that the protocol says that setUp() and
> teardown() should be for administration of the test and that the
> business of the test should be done within the test* methods.

Exactly! The verification of mock expectations is something generic and
administrative... ;-)

> In the
> jMock library, we have a VerifyingTestCase that overrides runBare() to
> support this approach.

So you see you're also considering the expectation validation as
administrative as you're even hiding it in the framework... :-)

-Vincent

>
> S.
